title: All Work All Play Pre-Show

embed.description: Lumia Cocktail Bar - Crown Casino for a drink and chat about all things eSports before we all head to Village Cinemas Crown to watch the All Work All Play documentary!

body:
Good Evening Summoners, 

We at Silicon Sports are hosting a pre-show drinks meet up at the Lumia Bar in Melbourne's Crown Casino before a viewing of the documentary 'All Work All Play'. This is a great chance to discover some of the local eSports community & events around Melbourne. 

---

All Work All Play: There's something happening in the world of video games. Thousands are flocking to arenas to watch tournaments unfold. Tens of millions are watching online. Not since the advent of television has a new entertainment medium so taken the world by storm.

From director Patrick Creadon (WORDPLAY) comes ALL WORK ALL PLAY: The Pursuit of eSports Glory, a new behind-the-scenes documentary that follows the ascent of eSports, showcasing the best pro gamers in the world as they fight for the Intel Extreme Masters championship.

On July 22 the film will screen Australia-wide as part of a captured live special event, followed by a Q&A with the director and a captured live eSports showdown. Top professional Starcraft II players and influencers of the gaming scene will battle it out in a 2v2 "Archon Mode" game of Starcraft II. All the excitement will be brought to you by a star-studded talent line-up including Kevin "Rotterdam" van der Kooi, James "Kaelaris" Carrol, and Joshua "Clutch" Gray*. 

Witness the next evolution of human competition. This is eSports.

----

You can purchase tickets for the movie [right here ](http://villagecinemas.com.au/movies/all_work_all_play)

Silicon Sports is an eSports community based in Melbourne, Australia. Our primary goal is to help eSports become an officially recognised sport within Australia & New Zealand similar to that of our Asian and US counterparts.

The organisation runs regular social events for major video game tournaments for the local gaming community. These are known as BarCrafts for the game StarCraft 2, Pubstomps for the game DOTA 2 and MOBArs for the game League of Legends.

Silicon Sports also run their own tournaments, both online and at LANs, for several game titles.

Besides this, Silicon Sports helps local talented players by supporting them in a professional gaming team, Team Silicon Sports, otherwise known as SLCN.pro.

Silicon Sports hosted the very first BarCraft Melbourne event in March 2012 for StarCraft 2.
Silicon Sports hosted the very first PubStomp Melbourne event in July 2013.

For updates, subscribe to our twitter feed @siliconsports, like us at facebook.com/SiliconSports, join our Steam Group at /groups/siliconsports and keep an eye on the website siliconsports.net.

We will be meeting up pre-show to speak with Melbourne eSports fans and discuss all things E-Sports. 

If you live in Melbourne We'd love to meet you and talk about regular events you can attend around the CBD and the suburbs. 

Please feel free to sign up, visit us at [Silicon Sports ](http://siliconsports.net/)and we hope to see you around at some of our events.
